2410.08613.title: Cross-Modal Bidirectional Interaction Model for Referring Remote Sensing Image Segmentation
2410.08613.paper_summary:
Given a natural language expression and a remote sensing image, the goal of
referring remote sensing image segmentation (RRSIS) is to generate a
pixel-level mask of the target object identified by the referring expression.
In contrast to natural scenarios, expressions in RRSIS often involve complex
geospatial relationships, with target objects of interest that vary
significantly in scale and lack visual saliency, thereby increasing the
difficulty of achieving precise segmentation. To address the aforementioned
challenges, a novel RRSIS framework is proposed, termed the cross-modal
bidirectional interaction model (CroBIM). Specifically, a context-aware prompt
modulation (CAPM) module is designed to integrate spatial positional
relationships and task-specific knowledge into the linguistic features, thereby
enhancing the ability to capture the target object. Additionally, a
language-guided feature aggregation (LGFA) module is introduced to integrate
linguistic information into multi-scale visual features, incorporating an
attention deficit compensation mechanism to enhance feature aggregation.
Finally, a mutual-interaction decoder (MID) is designed to enhance cross-modal
feature alignment through cascaded bidirectional cross-attention, thereby
enabling precise segmentation mask prediction. To further forster the research
of RRSIS, we also construct RISBench, a new large-scale benchmark dataset
comprising 52,472 image-language-label triplets. Extensive benchmarking on
RISBench and two other prevalent datasets demonstrates the superior performance
of the proposed CroBIM over existing state-of-the-art (SOTA) methods. The
source code for CroBIM and the RISBench dataset will be publicly available at
https://github.com/HIT-SIRS/CroBIM
2410.08613.paper_summary_zh:
<paragraph>給定自然語言表達式和遙感影像，指涉遙感影像分割 (RRSIS) 的目標是產生由指涉表達式識別的目標物體的像素級遮罩。
與自然場景相比，RRSIS 中的表達式通常涉及複雜的地理空間關係，目標物體的興趣在尺度上變化很大，並且缺乏視覺顯著性，從而增加了實現精確分割的難度。為了應對上述挑戰，提出了一個新穎的 RRSIS 框架，稱為跨模態雙向交互模型 (CroBIM)。具體來說，設計了一個上下文感知提示調製 (CAPM) 模塊，將空間位置關係和特定於任務的知識整合到語言特徵中，從而增強捕獲目標物體的能力。此外，引入了一個語言引導特徵聚合 (LGFA) 模塊，將語言信息整合到多尺度視覺特徵中，並結合注意力缺陷補償機制來增強特徵聚合。最後，設計了一個相互作用解碼器 (MID) 來通過級聯雙向交叉注意力增強跨模態特徵對齊，從而實現精確的分割掩碼預測。為了進一步促進 RRSIS 的研究，我們還構建了 RISBench，這是一個包含 52,472 個圖像語言標籤三元組的新的大規模基準數據集。在 RISBench 和另外兩個流行數據集上的廣泛基準測試證明了所提出的 CroBIM 優於現有的最先進 (SOTA) 方法。CroBIM 的源代碼和 RISBench 數據集將在 https://github.com/HIT-SIRS/CroBIM 公開發布</paragraph>
